thread.title_full: A walking holiday is the ultimate way to explore - Telegraph

author: Beverley Glick
title: A walking holiday is the ultimate way to explore
text: They say you haven’t truly seen a country until you’ve explored it on foot. But Ramblers Worldwide Holidays takes this idea a step further: the walking holiday specialist reckons that the way to feel the soul of a country is through the soles of your feet. There’s simply no better way of getting close to the spirit of a destination – and this is at the core of what Ramblers Worldwide Holidays offers. It has a hugely varied selection of more than 250 holidays in 70 countries to suit all walking abilities, with flexible itineraries that range from gentle sightseeing to trekking. If you’ve ever wanted to discover a little-known country but have been apprehensive about going there independently, joining a small Ramblers Worldwide Holidays group is the ideal solution. Wherever you choose to walk, you’ll experience the benefits of travelling with the original walking experts – the company was established in 1946. Years of experience have enabled Ramblers Worldwide Holidays to offer its customers extra-special touches that keep the company ahead of its competitors. A combination of unrivalled knowledge, extensive research and a respected reputation in every location it visits means that Ramblers Worldwide Holidays can show you the path less travelled in popular destinations while sharing its best-kept secrets. Choosing your comfort level and picking the walking grade that suits your ability is the key to an enjoyable holiday. You can be adventurous and explore the world’s high places with Ramblers Worldwide Holidays' energetic and challenging grades, or, if you’d prefer something gentler, stroll around Europe’s historic cities, climb undemanding slopes or follow scenic coastal paths on leisurely and moderate grades of itinerary. As well as walking, you could indulge your passion for hobbies such as birdwatching, wildlife, cooking and gardening An added bonus is that an experienced, qualified leader will accompany you every step of the way. As well as guiding you to authentic experiences wherever you roam, your leader will take the hard work out of your holiday. And in your small group, you’ll no doubt make new friends as well as walking companions. You’ll also be staying in hand-picked, tried-and-tested accommodation. Many Ramblers Worldwide Holidays trips are themed, which means that, as well as walking, you could indulge your passion for hobbies such as birdwatching, wildlife, cooking and gardening. There are also holidays that take in the world’s great trekking and pilgrimage routes. You can even take a cruise with a walking theme, on which Ramblers Worldwide Holidays' leaders guide you on walks through the spectacular landscapes in ports of call such as Norway, Iceland, Greenland, the Canaries and the Caribbean. Every holiday sold helps to provide money for the Ramblers Holidays Charitable Trust, which channels funds back into outdoor conservation and experience projects in the UK. There is also a venture called The Walking Partnership, which directly funds walking groups and clubs in the UK as well as Heart & Sole, the charity chosen and managed by office staff to support particular projects overseas. Ramblers Worldwide Holidays walking holidays represent great value for money and best practice is guaranteed. So why not stir your soul through the soles of your feet with the walking holiday specialist? Julia Bradbury – Roving Ambassador Television personality Julia Bradbury, who is best known for presenting BBC’s Countryfile , has recently been appointed Ramblers Worldwide Holidays’ first roving ambassador. A great lover of the outdoors, she has a passion for walking – particularly in the Lake District, the setting for her BBC4 series Wainwright Walks . She has presented walking series all over the UK and the world, including Germany, Iceland and South Africa. Julia says: “It’s fantastic to be the first roving ambassador for Ramblers Worldwide Holidays, a real privilege, and I’m delighted to be involved with an operator which shares my love of hiking and does so much to support environmental projects in the UK and community projects overseas.” In partnership with Ramblers Worldwide Holidays, the Telegraph is hosting an audience with Julia Bradbury on Thursday 15 October. • Find advice, rewards and a brochure at Ramblers Worldwide Holidays or simply call an expert on 01707 331133
